name: Define EBS Snapshot Lifecycle Policies
description: Ensure that Amazon EBS snapshot lifecycle policies are defined using AWS Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM). These policies should automate the creation, retention, and deletion of EBS snapshots according to your data retention and compliance requirements.

name: Encrypt DLM Cross-Region Copy Events with AWS KMS Customer Managed Key
description: Ensure that cross-region copy events in Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) are encrypted using an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Key (CMK). This provides an additional layer of security for data being transferred across regions.

name: Encrypt DLM Cross-Region Copy Schedules with AWS KMS Customer Managed Key
description: Ensure that cross-region copy schedules in Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) are encrypted using an AWS Key Management Service (KMS) Customer Managed Key (CMK). This enhances the security of scheduled cross-region data transfers.

name: Implement Least Privilege Access for DLM Policies
description: Ensure that IAM policies for Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) follow the principle of least privilege. Grant only the necessary permissions required for DLM to perform its functions, such as creating and managing snapshots, and avoid overly permissive policies.

name: Enable Retention of DLM Policy-Created Resources
description: Configure Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) policies to retain snapshots and AMIs for an appropriate duration based on your data retention requirements and compliance needs. This ensures that critical point-in-time backups are available when needed.

name: Use Tags for DLM Policy Resource Selection
description: Utilize resource tags in Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) policies to accurately select the EBS volumes or EC2 instances for snapshot or AMI creation. This ensures that the correct resources are included in your backup strategy.

name: Implement Cross-Account Sharing for DLM Snapshots
description: When necessary, configure Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) policies to share snapshots with other AWS accounts securely. Ensure that proper access controls are in place and that only required snapshots are shared with the appropriate accounts.

name: Enable Fast Snapshot Restore for Critical Volumes
description: For critical EBS volumes, configure Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) policies to enable Fast Snapshot Restore. This feature allows for improved performance when creating volumes from snapshots, which can be crucial for quick disaster recovery scenarios.

name: Implement Monitoring for DLM Policy Execution
description: Set up monitoring and alerting for Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) policy execution using Amazon CloudWatch. This helps ensure that snapshot and AMI creation processes are running as expected and allows for quick identification of any issues.

name: Regularly Review and Update DLM Policies
description: Implement a process to regularly review and update Data Lifecycle Manager (DLM) policies. This should include verifying that the policies are aligned with current business needs, compliance requirements, and best practices for data protection and cost optimization.
